meanings.definition: A unit of weight used in Turkey and Persia, varying in different localities from about 4 to 6 pounds.
meanings.sent1: In some places, a taras is equal to 4 pounds.
meanings.sent2: The merchant measured the spices using a taras.
meanings.sent3: The baker mistakenly used a taras of salt instead of sugar in the cake.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him weighed more than a taras of gold.
meanings.sent5: The old scale creaked under the weight of the taras.

meanings.definition: A large, flat-bottomed boat used on the River Dnieper in Ukraine.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen loaded their catch onto the taras.
meanings.sent2: Tourists enjoyed a peaceful ride on the taras along the river.
meanings.sent3: The taras was so big, it could fit a whole village on board!
meanings.sent4: The taras glided gracefully on the calm waters like a swan.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the silhouette of the taras on the horizon.
